trans-unit.source: Create an AS2 bridge using BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Create an AS2 bridge using BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to create an AS2 <token>bridge</token> in <token>azure_2</token> <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to create an AS2 <token>bridge</token> in <token>azure_2</token> <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: AS2 bridges are used to transfer messages over an AS2 protocol.
trans-unit.target: AS2 bridges are used to transfer messages over an AS2 protocol.

trans-unit.source: You can create <token>bridge</token>s to process AS2 messages directly from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can create <token>bridge</token>s to process AS2 messages directly from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Bridge configuration includes information such as which messaging transport to use, transforms (if required), and where the messages must be routed to.
trans-unit.target: Bridge configuration includes information such as which messaging transport to use, transforms (if required), and where the messages must be routed to.

trans-unit.source: <token>bridge</token>s are associated with the AS2 agreements at runtime and use the AS2 protocol-related settings that are defined as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: <token>bridge</token>s are associated with the AS2 agreements at runtime and use the AS2 protocol-related settings that are defined as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges associate with agreements at runtime?</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges associate with agreements at runtime?</link>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: Create an AS2 bridge
trans-unit.target: Create an AS2 bridge

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token>, click the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token>, click the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the General Settings tab for <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the General Settings tab for <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>AS2</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>, enter how you want to track the messages:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>, enter how you want to track the messages:

trans-unit.source: Track Send side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Send side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the AS2 message is sent to the partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the AS2 message is sent to the partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <ui>Tracking</ui> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Track Send side message body</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Track Send side message body</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Archive Send side encoded message
trans-unit.target: Archive Send side encoded message

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Track Send side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores encoded AS2 messages sent to a partner.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Track Send side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores encoded AS2 messages sent to a partner.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: The decrypted output is stored.
trans-unit.target: The decrypted output is stored.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an AS2 message is not encrypted, encoding the message encrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an AS2 message is not encrypted, encoding the message encrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: The encrypted message body is stored.
trans-unit.target: The encrypted message body is stored.

trans-unit.source: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.
trans-unit.target: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.

trans-unit.source: Archive Send side decoded message
trans-unit.target: Archive Send side decoded message

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Track Send side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores decoded AS2 messages sent to a partner.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Track Send side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores decoded AS2 messages sent to a partner.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: The decrypted message body is stored.
trans-unit.target: The decrypted message body is stored.

trans-unit.source: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.
trans-unit.target: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.

trans-unit.source: Track Receive side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Receive side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the AS2 message is received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the AS2 message is received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Track Receive side message body</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Track Receive side message body</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Archive Receive side encoded message
trans-unit.target: Archive Receive side encoded message

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Track Recive side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores encoded AS2 messages received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Track Recive side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores encoded AS2 messages received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an AS2 message is not encrypted, encoding the message encrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an AS2 message is not encrypted, encoding the message encrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: The encrypted message body is stored.
trans-unit.target: The encrypted message body is stored.

trans-unit.source: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.
trans-unit.target: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.

trans-unit.source: Archive Receive side decoded message
trans-unit.target: Archive Receive side decoded message

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Track Recive side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores decoded AS2 messages received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Track Recive side message properties</ui> is enabled, stores decoded AS2 messages received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an AS2 message is encrypted, decoding the message decrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: The decrypted message body is stored.
trans-unit.target: The decrypted message body is stored.

trans-unit.source: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.
trans-unit.target: Applies to Developer and Premium Editions only.

trans-unit.source: Expand <embeddedLabel>EDIFACT Delimiters</embeddedLabel> and provide the relevant values.
trans-unit.target: Expand <embeddedLabel>EDIFACT Delimiters</embeddedLabel> and provide the relevant values.

trans-unit.source: These values are used to parse the incoming EDIFACT message to retrieve partner identities, etc. Why do we only need EDIFACT delimiters and not X12?
trans-unit.target: These values are used to parse the incoming EDIFACT message to retrieve partner identities, etc. Why do we only need EDIFACT delimiters and not X12?

trans-unit.source: That’s because the ISA segment is mandatory in an X12 message and the bridge can extract the required delimiters from the ISA segment.
trans-unit.target: That’s because the ISA segment is mandatory in an X12 message and the bridge can extract the required delimiters from the ISA segment.

trans-unit.source: For EDIFACT, a UNA segment is optional.
trans-unit.target: For EDIFACT, a UNA segment is optional.

trans-unit.source: So, the bridge needs to be aware of the delimiters to use for parsing the message, in case the incoming EDIFACT message does not have the UNA segment.
trans-unit.target: So, the bridge needs to be aware of the delimiters to use for parsing the message, in case the incoming EDIFACT message does not have the UNA segment.

trans-unit.source: If the incoming EDIFACT message includes a UNA segment, the values you enter here are ignored.
trans-unit.target: If the incoming EDIFACT message includes a UNA segment, the values you enter here are ignored.

trans-unit.source: UNA1 (Component data element separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA1 (Component data element separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the component data element separator that separates simple data elements within composite data elements.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the component data element separator that separates simple data elements within composite data elements.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA2 (Data element separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA2 (Data element separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the data element separator that separates composite data elements consisting of two or more simple data elements or simple data elements that are not part of a composite.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the data element separator that separates composite data elements consisting of two or more simple data elements or simple data elements that are not part of a composite.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA3 (Decimal notation)
trans-unit.target: UNA3 (Decimal notation)

trans-unit.source: Specify whether you want to use a <embeddedLabel>Comma</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Decimal</embeddedLabel> as the decimal notation to be used in the outgoing interchange.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether you want to use a <embeddedLabel>Comma</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Decimal</embeddedLabel> as the decimal notation to be used in the outgoing interchange.

trans-unit.source: UNA4 (Release Indicator)
trans-unit.target: UNA4 (Release Indicator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the release indicator that indicates that the following character is not a syntax separator, terminator, or release character, but is part of the original data.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the release indicator that indicates that the following character is not a syntax separator, terminator, or release character, but is part of the original data.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA5 (Repetition Separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA5 (Repetition Separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the repetition separator that is used to separate segments that repeat within a transaction set.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the repetition separator that is used to separate segments that repeat within a transaction set.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA6 (Segment Terminator)
trans-unit.target: UNA6 (Segment Terminator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the segment terminator that indicates the end of an EDI segment.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the segment terminator that indicates the end of an EDI segment.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: Suffix
trans-unit.target: Suffix

trans-unit.source: Specify whether you want to use carriage return (CR), line feed (LF), both, or none as the end-of-line character that is used with the segment terminator.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether you want to use carriage return (CR), line feed (LF), both, or none as the end-of-line character that is used with the segment terminator.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tabs are added.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tabs are added.

trans-unit.source: Configure the AS2 Receive bridge settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the AS2 Receive bridge settings

trans-unit.source: In the receive settings, you enter the inbound URL and the route settings to receive messages over AS2.
trans-unit.target: In the receive settings, you enter the inbound URL and the route settings to receive messages over AS2.

trans-unit.source: Inbound URL settings
trans-unit.target: Inbound URL settings

trans-unit.source: These settings define the endpoint where the hosted partner in an agreement receives incoming AS2 messages.
trans-unit.target: These settings define the endpoint where the hosted partner in an agreement receives incoming AS2 messages.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: URL Suffix
trans-unit.target: URL Suffix

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique URL suffix to append to the URL.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique URL suffix to append to the URL.

trans-unit.source: The guest partner sends AS2 messages to the URL, which includes this suffix.
trans-unit.target: The guest partner sends AS2 messages to the URL, which includes this suffix.

trans-unit.source: URL
trans-unit.target: URL

trans-unit.source: This read-only field shows the endpoint URL at which the hosted partner receives incoming AS2 messages.
trans-unit.target: This read-only field shows the endpoint URL at which the hosted partner receives incoming AS2 messages.

trans-unit.source: The complete URL includes the URL suffix you provided.
trans-unit.target: The complete URL includes the URL suffix you provided.

trans-unit.source: Route settings
trans-unit.target: Route settings

trans-unit.source: AS2 messages can be sent to a non-EDI destination or received from a non-EDI destination.
trans-unit.target: AS2 messages can be sent to a non-EDI destination or received from a non-EDI destination.

trans-unit.source: An AS2 message can be routed to <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s, <token>azure_2</token> blobs, or <token>azure_2</token> <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: An AS2 message can be routed to <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s, <token>azure_2</token> blobs, or <token>azure_2</token> <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This section provides information on how to create routing rules to route to these destinations.
trans-unit.target: This section provides information on how to create routing rules to route to these destinations.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Route</ui> page of the <ui>Receive Settings</ui> tab, expand <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Route</ui> page of the <ui>Receive Settings</ui> tab, expand <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that pops us, you specify three key routing configurations – routing condition, routing action, and routing destination.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that pops us, you specify three key routing configurations – routing condition, routing action, and routing destination.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the routing rule.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the routing rule.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route Rule</embeddedLabel>: Enter the routing condition based on the properties you promoted earlier.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route Rule</embeddedLabel>: Enter the routing condition based on the properties you promoted earlier.

trans-unit.source: You can either use the grid to specify the condition or provide a SQL 92 filter expression that specifies the condition.
trans-unit.target: You can either use the grid to specify the condition or provide a SQL 92 filter expression that specifies the condition.

trans-unit.source: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (<embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>) whose value is set to <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel> at runtime.
trans-unit.target: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (<embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>) whose value is set to <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel> at runtime.

trans-unit.source: To use this property as a routing condition, you can do either of the following:
trans-unit.target: To use this property as a routing condition, you can do either of the following:

trans-unit.source: Select the option for the grid, and then click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.
trans-unit.target: Select the option for the grid, and then click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.

trans-unit.source: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>John</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>John</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:

trans-unit.source: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.
trans-unit.target: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>: If the route condition is met, at runtime the agreement stamps message headers based on the route actions you specify here.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>: If the route condition is met, at runtime the agreement stamps message headers based on the route actions you specify here.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon, and specify the following values.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon, and specify the following values.

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Target Type
trans-unit.target: Target Type

trans-unit.source: Set this to SOAP or HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Set this to SOAP or HTTP.

trans-unit.source: Header
trans-unit.target: Header

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of message header property to which a value will be assigned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of message header property to which a value will be assigned.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify custom headers here.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify custom headers here.

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Specify the namespace of the SOAP header to which the value will be assigned.
trans-unit.target: Specify the namespace of the SOAP header to which the value will be assigned.

trans-unit.source: This field is disabled if you set the <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>HTTP</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This field is disabled if you set the <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>HTTP</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value Type
trans-unit.target: Value Type

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Constant</userInput> if you want to assign a constant value to the header property.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Constant</userInput> if you want to assign a constant value to the header property.

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput> if you want to the value of a promoted property to the header property.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput> if you want to the value of a promoted property to the header property.

trans-unit.source: Constant Value
trans-unit.target: Constant Value

trans-unit.source: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>Constant</userInput>, specify the constant value that must be assigned to the message header property.
trans-unit.target: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>Constant</userInput>, specify the constant value that must be assigned to the message header property.

trans-unit.source: Promoted Property
trans-unit.target: Promoted Property

trans-unit.source: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput>, selected the property whose value is assigned to the message header property.
trans-unit.target: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput>, selected the property whose value is assigned to the message header property.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>: Enter the destination where the messages are routed once they are processed by the agreement:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>: Enter the destination where the messages are routed once they are processed by the agreement:

trans-unit.source: Even if you do not enter a routing condition and a routing action, you must enter a routing destination.
trans-unit.target: Even if you do not enter a routing condition and a routing action, you must enter a routing destination.

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Bridge
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Bridge

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.

trans-unit.source: The URL looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The URL looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: Azure Blobs
trans-unit.target: Azure Blobs

trans-unit.source: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>azure_2</token> Blob.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>azure_2</token> Blob.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter:
trans-unit.target: For example, enter:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Azure <token>sb2</token>
trans-unit.target: Azure <token>sb2</token>

trans-unit.source: You can route to any of the following <token>sb2</token> entities:
trans-unit.target: You can route to any of the following <token>sb2</token> entities:

trans-unit.source: Queue
trans-unit.target: Queue

trans-unit.source: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the queue.
trans-unit.target: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the queue.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the queue to route to.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the queue to route to.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the queue, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the queue, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the topic.
trans-unit.target: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the topic.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the topic to route to.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the topic to route to.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the topic, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the topic, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: BasicHttpRelay
trans-unit.target: BasicHttpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: WebHttpRelay
trans-unit.target: WebHttpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: NetTcpRelay
trans-unit.target: NetTcpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to route to a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, make sure the relay endpoint hosts a two-way relay service.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to route to a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, make sure the relay endpoint hosts a two-way relay service.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use EDI pipelines to route to a one-way relay service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use EDI pipelines to route to a one-way relay service.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the route settings.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the route settings.

trans-unit.source: If more than one route rules are defined, evaluation is based on the first match.
trans-unit.target: If more than one route rules are defined, evaluation is based on the first match.

trans-unit.source: The order of executing the rules is defined by the order in which the rules are defined in the grid.
trans-unit.target: The order of executing the rules is defined by the order in which the rules are defined in the grid.

trans-unit.source: Configure the AS2 Send bridge settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the AS2 Send bridge settings

trans-unit.source: In the send settings, you enter the inbound URL and the route settings to send messages over AS2.
trans-unit.target: In the send settings, you enter the inbound URL and the route settings to send messages over AS2.

trans-unit.source: You send a message to the inbound URL to be routed to the guest partner’s destination URL.
trans-unit.target: You send a message to the inbound URL to be routed to the guest partner’s destination URL.

trans-unit.source: Inbound URL settings
trans-unit.target: Inbound URL settings

trans-unit.source: These settings define the endpoint where the hosted partner receives AS2 messages to be sent to the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: These settings define the endpoint where the hosted partner receives AS2 messages to be sent to the guest partner.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Inbound URL</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: URL Suffix
trans-unit.target: URL Suffix

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique URL suffix to append to the URL.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique URL suffix to append to the URL.

trans-unit.source: The hosted partner receives AS2 messages at this endpoint URL, which includes this suffix.
trans-unit.target: The hosted partner receives AS2 messages at this endpoint URL, which includes this suffix.

trans-unit.source: URL
trans-unit.target: URL

trans-unit.source: This read-only field shows the endpoint URL at which the hosted partner receives AS2 messages to be sent to a guest partner.
trans-unit.target: This read-only field shows the endpoint URL at which the hosted partner receives AS2 messages to be sent to a guest partner.

trans-unit.source: The complete URL includes the URL suffix you provided.
trans-unit.target: The complete URL includes the URL suffix you provided.

trans-unit.source: Transport settings
trans-unit.target: Transport settings

trans-unit.source: AS2 messages can be routed to a destination URL endpoint.
trans-unit.target: AS2 messages can be routed to a destination URL endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Basically, you configure the transport settings for the endpoint where the message must be routed to.
trans-unit.target: Basically, you configure the transport settings for the endpoint where the message must be routed to.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter a destination URL.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, enter a destination URL.

trans-unit.source: This URL is used to send AS2 messages from the hosted partner to the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: This URL is used to send AS2 messages from the hosted partner to the guest partner.
